Class TransactionDataManager

java.lang.Object
plasystem_functions.TransactionDataManager
public class TransactionDataManager extends Object
Manages transaction data in the PlaSystem database, providing functionality to add, load, and delete transactions, including their items, and update product quantities. Ensures database consistency through transactions and validates inputs against schema constraints.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    private static final String
    DELETE_TRANSACTION_QUERY
    SQL query to delete a transaction from the Transactions table.
    private static final String
    INSERT_TRANSACTION_ITEM_QUERY
    SQL query to insert a transaction item into the TransactionItems table.
    private static final String
    INSERT_TRANSACTION_QUERY
    SQL query to insert a new transaction into the Transactions table.
    private final ProductDataManager
    productDataManager
    Manager for product data operations, used to refresh product quantities after transactions.
    private static final String
    SELECT_ALL_TRANSACTIONS_QUERY
    SQL query to select all transactions from the Transactions table.
    private static final String
    SELECT_TRANSACTION_ITEMS_QUERY
    SQL query to select transaction items for a specific transaction from the TransactionItems table.
    private final List<TransactionData>
    transactionList
    In-memory list of transactions, synchronized with the database.
    private static final String
    UPDATE_PRODUCT_QUANTITY_QUERY
    SQL query to update the quantity of a product in the Product table.

  • Constructor Details

    • TransactionDataManager

      public TransactionDataManager(ProductDataManager productDataManager)
      Constructs a TransactionDataManager with a dependency on ProductDataManager and initializes the transaction list by loading all transactions from the database.
      Parameters:
      productDataManager - The manager for product data operations. Must not be null.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if productDataManager is null.

  • Method Details

    • loadTransactions

      public void loadTransactions()
      Loads all transactions and their associated items from the database into the in-memory transaction list. Clears the existing list before loading to ensure synchronization with the database. Displays an error message if a database error occurs.

    • loadTransactionItems

      private List<TransactionItemData> loadTransactionItems(int transId)
      Loads all transaction items for a given transaction ID from the TransactionItems table. Displays an error message if a database error occurs.
      Parameters:
      transId - The ID of the transaction. Must exist in the Transactions table.
      Returns:
      A list of TransactionItemData objects, possibly empty if no items are found.

    • addTransaction

      public int addTransaction(String transDateYear, String transDateMonth, String transDateDay, String transDateTime, double totalAmount, double paymentAmount, double changeAmount, List<TransactionItemData> transactionItems)
      Adds a new transaction to the database, including its items, and updates product quantities in a single transaction. Validates inputs against schema constraints and rounds monetary amounts to two decimal places. Refreshes the transaction and product lists upon success. Displays appropriate error messages for invalid inputs or database errors.
      Parameters:
      transDateYear - The year of the transaction date. Must not be null or empty.
      transDateMonth - The month of the transaction date. Must not be null or empty.
      transDateDay - The day of the transaction date. Must not be null or empty.
      transDateTime - The time of the transaction. Must not be null or empty.
      totalAmount - The total amount of the transaction. Must be non-negative.
      paymentAmount - The payment amount provided. Must be at least equal to totalAmount.
      changeAmount - The change returned. Must be non-negative.
      transactionItems - The list of transaction items. Must not be null or empty.
      Returns:
      The ID of the newly created transaction, or -1 if the operation fails.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if transactionItems is null.

    • deleteTransaction

      public boolean deleteTransaction(int transactionId)
      Deletes a transaction from the database by its ID, including its associated items. Refreshes the transaction list upon success. Displays an error message if the transaction ID does not exist or a database error occurs.
      Parameters:
      transactionId - The ID of the transaction to delete. Must exist in the database.
      Returns:
      true if the transaction was deleted successfully, false otherwise.

    • validateTransactionItem

      private boolean validateTransactionItem(TransactionItemData item)
      Validates a transaction item based on schema constraints for the TransactionItems table (e.g., non-null fields, positive quantity, non-negative prices, total price at least equal to unit price). Displays appropriate error messages for invalid inputs.
      Parameters:
      item - The TransactionItemData to validate. Must not be null.
      Returns:
      true if the item is valid, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if item is null.

    • getTransactionList

      public List<TransactionData> getTransactionList()
      Retrieves the in-memory list of all transactions, refreshing it from the database before returning.
      Returns:
      An unmodifiable view of the list of TransactionData objects.

    • getTotal

      public double getTotal(List<TransactionItemData> items)
      Calculates the total value of a list of transaction items, summing their total prices and rounding the result to two decimal places.
      Parameters:
      items - The list of TransactionItemData objects. Must not be null.
      Returns:
      The total value of the transaction items, rounded to two decimal places.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if items is null.
